title: Induced current - cart leaving magnetic field

content.question: A cart of mass <math alttext="0.500 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.500</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> moves through a magnetic field directed out of the page with a magnitude of <math alttext="0.250 tesla" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.250</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>T</mtext></math>. A square conducting loop with <math alttext="0.200 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> sides and negligible mass is fixed onto the cart such that it is insulated from the cart. The resistance of the loop is <math alttext="0.200 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Î©</mi></math>. What is the magnitude of the acceleration of the cart as the loop leaves the magnetic field at the moment the cart is moving at <math alttext="5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.0625 meter per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0625</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>
<math alttext="0.100 meter per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>
<math alttext="0.125 meter per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.125</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>
<math alttext="1.25 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.125 meter per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.125</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
